channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A new U.S. peace plan asks Ukraine for steep concessions
item.description: U.S. and Ukrainian officials are negotiating a contentious peace plan in Geneva that would require major concessions from Kyiv.
item.content:encoded: U.S. and Ukrainian officials are negotiating a contentious peace plan in Geneva that would require major concessions from Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Are we entering a new nuclear arms race?
item.description: Yaroslav Trofimov of The Wall Street Journal explains why he thinks that the U.S., Russia, and China have entered a new nuclear race.
item.content:encoded: Yaroslav Trofimov of The Wall Street Journal explains why he thinks that the U.S., Russia, and China have entered a new nuclear race.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: What film has become your family's holiday ritual?
item.description: NPR's Stephen Thompson and Kathryn Fink talk about the movies their families return to every holiday season and why those traditions stick.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Stephen Thompson and Kathryn Fink talk about the movies their families return to every holiday season and why those traditions stick.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: Why do we get goosebumps? A podcast tries to answer science's surprising questions
item.description: Hakeem Oluseyi, host of NOVA and GBH's podcast Particles of Thought, breaks down how his show tackles some of science's biggest and strangest questions.
item.content:encoded: Hakeem Oluseyi, host of NOVA and GBH's podcast Particles of Thought, breaks down how his show tackles some of science's biggest and strangest questions.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Looking at Michelle Wu's vision for Boston to test a new model for Democratic leadership
item.description: After Zohran Mamdani's win in New York, many are asking if charismatic, progressive mayors can save the Democratic Party. Looking at Michelle Wu's record in Boston, along with Mamdani's campaign, offers some insights into what is energizing voters.
item.content:encoded: After Zohran Mamdani's win in New York, many are asking if charismatic, progressive mayors can save the Democratic Party. Looking at Michelle Wu's record in Boston, along with Mamdani's campaign, offers some insights into what is energizing voters.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: The Mount Rushmore we know wasn't the one originally planned
item.description: Matthew Davis, author of a Mount Rushmore biography, explains how four presidents ended up on a mountain that was never meant to honor them.
item.content:encoded: Matthew Davis, author of a Mount Rushmore biography, explains how four presidents ended up on a mountain that was never meant to honor them.
item.dc:creator: Justine Kenin

item.title: Rep. Greene's resignation triggers uncertainty as voters weigh her break with Trump
item.description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning after a break with President Trump made a primary fight inevitable, says Georgia Public Broadcasting reporter Sarah Kallis.
item.content:encoded: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning after a break with President Trump made a primary fight inevitable, says Georgia Public Broadcasting reporter Sarah Kallis.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Kallis

item.title: At COP30, nations agree on adaptation funding but remain split on emissions
item.description: Global climate talks in Brazil wrapped up with a deal to increase funding for countries hit by warming but no plan to phase out fossil fuels.
item.content:encoded: Global climate talks in Brazil wrapped up with a deal to increase funding for countries hit by warming but no plan to phase out fossil fuels.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Researchers say a CDC website change misrepresents vaccine science
item.description: This week a CDC website briefly suggested a vaccine–autism link, prompting experts to urge the public to rely on credible medical guidance.
item.content:encoded: This week a CDC website briefly suggested a vaccine–autism link, prompting experts to urge the public to rely on credible medical guidance.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Across Europe, the left searches for its next 'Mamdani'
item.description: The New York mayor-elect's unexpected victory has energized the European left, with politicians casting themselves as their country's version of Mamdani, and strategists eager to study how he won.
item.content:encoded: The New York mayor-elect's unexpected victory has energized the European left, with politicians casting themselves as their country's version of Mamdani, and strategists eager to study how he won.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab
